movies.title: Little Trouble Girls
movies.description: A coming-of-age drama centered on young women navigating personal and social upheaval, released by specialty distributor Kino Lorber in a rare wide theatrical launch.[3]

movies.title: Eastern Western
movies.description: An all-ages adventure-western blending frontier action with family drama as characters journey across rugged landscapes, released nationwide by Purdie Distribution.[3]

movies.title: How the Grinch Stole Christmas (2025 Re-release)
movies.description: Seasonal wide re-release of Ron Howard’s live-action Dr. Seuss adaptation starring Jim Carrey as the Grinch, returning to cinemas as a holiday family event.[3]

movies.title: Scarlet
movies.genre: Action, Adventure, Animation, Fantasy, Sci-Fi, Romance
movies.description: An animated fantasy-sci-fi epic from Sony that follows a heroine in a visually rich world blending action, romance, and speculative elements, released nationwide.[3]

movies.title: Silent Night, Deadly Night
movies.description: A new entry in the holiday horror brand "Silent Night, Deadly Night," featuring a Christmas-set slasher narrative, opening wide via Iconic Events Releasing.[3][6]

movies.title: REBBECA: Becky G
movies.description: Concert documentary event featuring Becky G, released as a limited-time music special in select theaters through Trafalgar Releasing.[3]

movies.title: The Cure: The Show of a Lost World
movies.description: Concert film capturing The Cure’s "The Show of a Lost World" tour, playing as a one- or few-night special engagement via Trafalgar Releasing.[3]

movies.title: Devoted Heart
movies.description: A faith-tinged family romance about love, sacrifice, and devotion, released in a targeted limited rollout by Atlas Distribution Company.[3]

movies.title: Visions
movies.description: A psychological mystery-thriller following a woman plagued by disturbing visions that blur reality and paranoia, released in limited arthouse engagements by Dark Sky Films.[3]

movies.title: Atropia
movies.description: A war drama exploring the human and political fallout in a conflict zone, anchored by Alia Shawkat and released on a limited basis by Vertical Entertainment.[3]

movies.title: Europe's New Faces
movies.description: A documentary focusing on emerging European political or cultural leaders and shifting identities across the continent, opening in very limited U.S. arthouse playdates.[3]

movies.title: Motherland
movies.description: An intimate character drama exploring family, identity, and generational tension, led by Miriam Silverman and Holland Taylor in limited coastal runs.[3]

movies.title: Ella McCay
movies.description: A political-tinged comedy-drama about an ambitious young woman working in government, featuring Emma Mackey and a strong ensemble, opening as a limited awards-season play for Disney.[3][9]

movies.title: Lone Samurai
movies.description: A samurai-inspired action drama featuring intense martial-arts choreography, released by Well Go USA in a targeted genre-focused limited rollout.[3]

movies.title: Resurrection
movies.description: An epic, 160-minute science-fiction drama imported and released by Janus Films, starting in select cities before a later wide expansion later in the month.[3]

movies.title: Pose
movies.description: A contained thriller led by James McAvoy, centering on a tense high-stakes situation where characters’ public images and identities are weaponized, opening in limited release.[3]

movies.title: Reedland
movies.description: A European art-house drama distributed by Outsider Pictures, focused on life in a rural reedland region and the relationships shaped by its landscape, playing very limited runs.[3]

movies.title: Thieves Highway
movies.description: An action-crime film about criminals and law enforcement intersecting on a perilous smuggling route, headlined by Aaron Eckhart and Devon Sawa in a modest limited rollout.[3]

movies.title: Christina Aguilera: Christmas in Paris
movies.description: A holiday concert film featuring Christina Aguilera performing Christmas music in Paris, presented as a limited-event theatrical engagement.[3]
